sub_title: Water and Global Change| Building Sustainable and Resilient Water Systems.
summary:
Growing up in Numan – a town by the river Gongola, in North-eastern Nigeria, has given me firsthand experience on flooding, health dangers from water pollution, water conflict, forced migration, and trivialized girl-child education. This instilled in me passion for education, and desire to contribute to solving water management challenges. My interest in addressing the gaps in water policy implementation, and failure to adopt climate adaptation strategies in water management practices has been my motivation.

Over the past 8 years, I have acquired education in the field of hydrology, groundwater, global and climate change through international scholarships; hence leveraging my intellectual prowess, proven record of academic excellence, leadership skills, and passion for sustainable development. 

I have an understanding of the water nexus and the interdisciplinary dimensions of sustainable water management. Through internships in organisations such as the International Groundwater Assessment Centre (IGRAC), I have developed skills in research and consultancy which are important for conceptualizing and solving water problems. As an advocate, I believe that research is the foundation for successful advocacy.

I look forward to offering my expertise in solving water-related problems.

I enjoy meeting new people, hearing new perspectives, learning about different cultures, and trying new cooking recipes.

awards.title: i-Scholar Initiative Scholarship
awards.description:
This scholarship is funded by the generous donations of kind-hearted men and women
who share the iSI vision. The iSI Partners are fundamentally driven by the passion to impact the lives of 
talented but less privileged next-generation professionals.
The award covers:  payment of GRE/GMAT fee, payment of TOEFL fee contingent upon satisfactory score obtained in GRE/GMAT, payment of a predetermined number of application fees contingent upon satisfactory performance in standardized tests and evidence of financial difficulty, provision of mentorship through assigned mentors, career support and development.

awards.title: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree Scholarship in Groundwater and Global Change - Impacts and Adaptation
awards.description: The scholarship is offered competitively to students from all over the world based on a rating scheme with specific emphasis on previous academic performance and professional qualifications. The scholarship covers the student's participation costs, full insurance coverage, a monthly subsistence allowance, and student travel and installation costs during the study period.

awards.title: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in Applied Ecohydrology
awards.description: The scholarship is offered competitively to students from all over the world based on a rating scheme with specific emphasis on previous academic performance and professional qualifications. The scholarship covers the student's participation costs, full insurance coverage, a monthly subsistence allowance, and student travel and installation costs during the study period.

awards.title: Mastercard Foundation Scholarship to the Master Bioresource Engineering – Integrated Water Resources Management (Non-Thesis) Programme, tenable at McGill University, Montreal, Canada.
awards.description:
The Mastercard Foundation Scholarship is awarded based on academic excellence, leadership contributions and potential and financially disadvantaged persons. The scholarship covers all eligible expenses in full while you are studying at McGill University, including the following: 
• Tuition Fees. 
• Pre-Arrival Expenses, including cost of medical exam and required immigration documents at cost
• Return transportation at cost
• Fall/Winter Additional (Ancillary) Fees at cost
• Fall/Winter Health and Dental Insurance at cost
• Personal Expenses
 Required Books and Supplies
• Housing in Residence 
• Food 
• If applicable, an approved internship in the home country, or on the African continent, including 
return transportation and stipend
• One laptop computer

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed and edited tools on various topics related to IWRM: (i.e., reviewed and edited the 86 IWRM Action Hub tools and solicited stakeholder feedback. Developed content for the tools on Nature-based Solutions, Customary water law, and Water allocation regimes).
•	Created and built documents for the “Platform Catalogue” feature which is repository of water-related platforms to promote knowledge sharing, interdisciplinary and integrated water management.
•	Reached out to relevant organisations in the sustainable development sector to establish collaboration alliances for the IWRM Action Hub.
•	Cooperated with Communications specialist, and Digital Marketing Associate to create social media card content.
•	Uploaded event updates and generated questionnaire forms for the IWRM Action Hub, Communities of Practices, and country office.
•	Conducted stakeholder tagging in the IWRM Action Hub. 
•	Contributed to developing content for the Stockholm World Water Week game and implementing them on the platform. 
•	Mapped and loaded relevant technical and academic references in the IWRM Action HUB platform.
•	Produced a video demonstrating how to upload content to the IWRM Action HUB.

profile_positions.title: Junior Rapporteur

profile_positions.description:
IGRAC (International Groundwater Resources Assessment Centre)  is a UNESCO Global Groundwater Centre that works under the auspices of the World Meteorological Organization and is a key partner of the International Association of Hydrogeologists. It facilitates and promotes the international sharing of information and knowledge required for sustainable groundwater resource development and management worldwide. My role in IGRAC enhanced my expertise in carrying out research in groundwater impacts with a focus on transboundary aquifers.

Accomplishment:

I examined the evidence of documented cases of cross-border groundwater impacts associated with transboundary aquifer (TBA) use or contamination in Africa and America. I recorded a total of over 30 cases. I am confident that this inventory of evidence will provide insights into the types and scales of cross-border impacts.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The Federal University Oye, Ekiti, is located within Oye community, Nigeria. It is one of the institutions of higher learning in Nigeria which aspires to become an institution of first choice recognized for providing critical opportunities for student success. In my role as a graduate assistant, I demonstrated my understanding of the concept of hydrology and ability to communicate effectively. 

Accomplishments:

- Organized a seminar for undergraduate final year students on career prospects in Water Resources Management, and through that, rekindled their interests in pursuing a career in water resources management.
- Gathered, analyzed, and documented daily inventory meteorological indices from the weather station.
- Measured, compiled, and cataloged hydro-meteorological indices into computerized group modules.
- Administered meteorological and hydro-meteorological data for research purposes with the permission of the Head of Department.
- Assisted the head of the department in carrying out his academic, research, and administrative duties.
- Tutored, and guided students in laboratory analysis, and managed the meteorological station.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Assistant

profile_positions.description:
The Ekiti State Water Corporation provides potable water and safe sewage services to the residents of urban areas and small towns in Ekiti State at a sustainable price. My role at the Corporation enabled me to actively engage my skillsets in integrated water resources management.

Accomplishments: 

- Prepared annual budgets, bills, and tenders for the Corporation.
- Inspected, and implemented rehabilitation programs, and projects.
- Reviewed management practices in the Water Corporation.
- Generated geological reports, archived cataloged well logs, and maps of wells drilled in the city of Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti State. 
- Collected samples of treated water, and analyzed them in the laboratory to determine their safety for use. 
- Prepared annual budgets, bills, tenders, and reports on annual watershed protection and water supply projects. 
- Participated in all phases of project management for groundwater exploration projects carried out by the organization. 
- Diagnosed and inspected treatment of contaminated water wells in all the schemes of the Corporation.
profile_positions.title: Intern at the Department of Planning, Research and Statistics.

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Safe Environment Initiative Forum is a not-for-profit non-governmental organisation with a mandate of responding to the critical environmental needs of the Abeokuta community. My contributions to this initiative improved my communication and interpersonal skills and enabled me to carry out my civic duty of patriotism.

Accomplishment: 

Collaborated with Water Step (an NGO) to distribute disinfectants (bleach), and palliatives across primary health care centers to prevent and fight the spread of Covid 19.
Delivered a lecture on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and sensitized students on proper hand washing habits.
Participated in regular clean-up events in Ogun state.
Educated the public on tips on how to stay safe during the pandemic via social media platforms.

The National Youth Service Corps scheme was created in a bid to reconstruct, reconcile and rebuild the country after the Nigerian Civil war. The purpose of the scheme is primarily to inculcate in Nigerian Youths the spirit of selfless service to the community, and to emphasize the spirit of oneness and brotherhood of all Nigerians, irrespective of cultural or social background. As a secretary of the NYSC scheme at a regional level, I demonstrated my leadership capabilities and intercultural communication and relations. 

Accomplishments:

Kept records and monitored all the activities and projects on Community Development carried out by Corps Members of the Oye-zone.
Revitalized the zone by encouraging interactive and expository discussions and sessions by various community development scheme groups. This led to the completion and execution of 7 community development scheme projects through partnership.

volunteer_experiences.role: Secretary, Sustainable Development Goals Community Development Scheme Group, Oye zone.
volunteer_experiences.description:
Accomplishments:

Sensitized about 200 Saint Augustine and Oye-Egbo High School students on the Sustainable Development Goals. 
Supported a fellow member’s project on teenage girls’ sensitization of menstrual hygiene, which had a gathering of over 100 teenage girls where I emphasized the role of clean water in proper hygiene and sanitation.
I successfully managed a library rehabilitation project.
